channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Thorny low hanging branches across pavement needs pruning, 8th August
item.description:
This tree has very low hanging branches reaching across the pavement. They have grown quickly due to recent weather and are unavoidable. The branches are well below adult head height and are very thorny and sharp, making them dangerous to pedestrians. Please prune these back to avoid any further injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request for Cycle Lanes on Homerton High Street to Homerton Road, 8th August
item.description:
The stretch between Homerton High Street and Homerton Road is extremely dangerous for cyclists. I was injured here when a vehicle turned left across my path, and I’ve seen others suffer accidents. Please install protected cycle lanes urgently.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface is getting worse, 8th August
item.description:
This matter has been reported before, but the raid surface is getting Sloan’s deeper to the point that road users need to drive around the poor road surface. Again the government has provided funds to road surfaces to be repo and made safe for road users

item.title: Lime and Forest Bikes left throughout the day, 8th August
item.description:
Bikes each morning left in the area. On Gracechurch Street, outside No.20, No,77 and the junction with Bell Inn Yard. These bikes are left throughout the day. Bikes are blocking the footway. Some bikes and left in live traffic lanes. Some bikes are not standing and are causing a trip hazards. There are both Lime Bikes and Forest Bikes in this area, although the largest numbers and Lime Bikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corbet Court, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
